# INTRODUCTION

Introduction is not mandatory, but when available, it begins on page 1

# OTHER HEADINGS AS APPROPRIATE

Research Documents explain technical information and data to support the advice. Other headings may include: Methods, Results & Discussion. These headings are optional and context dependent.

## LISTS

CSAS allows ordered lists:

::: {custom-style="List Number"}
1. Item 1
2. Item 2
:::

and bulleted lists:

::: {custom-style="List Bullet"}
- Item 1
- Item 2
:::

This is a reference to a figure: Figure \@ref(fig:example-fig).

This is a reference to a table: Table \@ref(tab:example-table).

## TABLES

```{r example-table, results='asis'}
set.seed(1)
df1 <- data.frame(year = 1:10, index = rlnorm(10))
flextable(df1) |> 
  set_table_properties(layout = "autofit", width = 1)
```

## FIGURES

```{r example-fig, fig.width=5}
df2 <- data.frame(x = rnorm(10), y = rnorm(10))
ggplot(df2, aes(x, y)) + geom_point() + theme_light()
```
